description.p: Sky Domain Clerics are devoted to the open heavens and believe in the ideals of freedom, trust, individualism and tranquility. Deities such as the Greek Titan Uranus, Goddess Hera, Roman God Jupiter, or Egyptian God Horus are example patrons of Sky Clerics. Gods of the sky can also embody the sun, air, righteous combat, personal potential, weather and freedom.

sheet.description: Sky Domain Clerics are devoted to the open heavens and believe in the ideals of freedom, trust, individualism and tranquility.

description.p: You gain domain spells at the cleric levels listed in the Sky Domain Spells table. See the Divine Domain class feature for how domain spells work.
At 1st level, you gain proficiency with Martial Weapons and Navigator’s Tools.

sheet.description: You gain proficiency with martial weapons and Navigator’s Tools.

description.p: Also at first level, you learn the Find Familiar spell and can cast it as a ritual, except no matter the form your familiar takes, it has a 30ft fly speed, can hover and gains appropriate anatomy to support flight. For example, a Weasel familiar might be granted a pair of spectral wings.

As a bonus action, you can grant your familiar immunity to all damage for the next minute, or until it deals damage to another creature. Once you use this feature, you cannot do so again until you finish a short or long rest.

description.p: At 2nd level, you can use your Channel Divinity to grant the power of flight to those around you.

As an action, you present your holy symbol, and a gentle beam of sunlight shines forth onto a creature within 5ft. They gain temporary hit points equal to twice your Cleric level, a flying speed equal to their walking speed and can hover. These abilities last until they finish a long rest, or you use this feature again.

description.p: Starting a 6th level, while in sunlight, you have advantage on attack rolls and perception checks that rely on sight.

sheet.description: While in sunlight, you have advantage on attack rolls and perception checks that rely on sight.

description.p: At 8th level, you gain the ability to imbue your weapon strikes with divine energy. Once on each of your turns when you hit a creature with a weapon Attack, you can cause the Attack to deal an extra 1d8 radiant damage to the target. When you reach 14th level, the extra damage increases to 2d8.

Once on each of your turns when you hit a creature with a weapon Attack, you can cause the Attack to deal an extra 2d8 radiant damage to the target.

description.p: Starting at 17th level, when you use your Skystrider Channel Divinity, you can impart the benefits to a number of creatures equal to your proficiency bonus. In addition, allied creatures within 60ft of you with a fly speed can dash as a bonus action, and their movement doesn’t provoke opportunity attacks.
